str2: Large, great, in the widest sense.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
Upright, straight, direct. Probably from the base of oros; right, i.e. erect, or level or direct.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To leap, leap up; of water: To spring up, bubble up.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
